translations.chinese: 項籍者，下相人也，字羽。
translations.literal: Xiang Ji was a man from Xiaxiang, styled Yu.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji came from the town of Xiaxiang and was styled Yu.

context.next: 初起時，年二十四。

translations.chinese: 初起時，年二十四。
translations.literal: When he first rose up, he was twenty-four years old.
translations.idiomatic: When he first took up arms, he was twenty-four years old.

context.previous: 項籍者，下相人也，字羽。
context.next: 其季父項梁，梁父即楚將項燕，為秦將王翦所戮者也。

translations.chinese: 其季父項梁，梁父即楚將項燕，為秦將王翦所戮者也。
translations.literal: His youngest uncle Xiang Liang; Liang's father was precisely the Chu general Xiang Yan, who was executed by the Qin general Wang Jian.
translations.idiomatic: His uncle Xiang Liang was the son of the Chu general Xiang Yan, who had been executed by the Qin general Wang Jian.

context.previous: 初起時，年二十四。
context.next: 項氏世世為楚將，封於項，故姓項氏。

translations.chinese: 項氏世世為楚將，封於項，故姓項氏。
translations.literal: The Xiang clan generation after generation served as Chu generals, were enfeoffed at Xiang, therefore took the surname Xiang.
translations.idiomatic: The Xiang family had served as generals for the state of Chu for generations. They were enfeoffed at Xiang, hence took the surname Xiang.

context.previous: 其季父項梁，梁父即楚將項燕，為秦將王翦所戮者也。

translations.chinese: 項籍少時，學書不成，去學劍，又不成。
translations.literal: When Xiang Ji was young, he studied writing but didn't succeed, then went to study swordsmanship, and again didn't succeed.
translations.idiomatic: In his youth, Xiang Ji tried to learn calligraphy but failed. He then tried swordsmanship but failed at that too.

context.next: 項梁怒之。

translations.chinese: 項梁怒之。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang was angry with him.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang grew angry with him.

context.previous: 項籍少時，學書不成，去學劍，又不成。
context.next: 籍曰：「書足以記名姓而已。

translations.chinese: 籍曰：「書足以記名姓而已。
translations.literal: Ji said: 'Writing is sufficient only to record names and surnames.
translations.idiomatic: Ji replied, 'Writing is only good for recording names and surnames.

context.previous: 項梁怒之。
context.next: 劍一人敵，不足學，學萬人敵。」

translations.chinese: 劍一人敵，不足學，學萬人敵。」
translations.literal: A sword fights one person, not worth learning; learn to fight ten thousand people.'
translations.idiomatic: A sword is for fighting one man—not worth studying. Learn to command armies of ten thousand.'

context.previous: 籍曰：「書足以記名姓而已。
context.next: 於是項梁乃教籍兵法，籍大喜，略知其意，又不肯竟學。

translations.chinese: 於是項梁乃教籍兵法，籍大喜，略知其意，又不肯竟學。
translations.literal: Thereupon Xiang Liang taught Ji military strategy. Ji was greatly pleased, understood its general principles, but again refused to study it completely.
translations.idiomatic: So Xiang Liang taught him the art of war. Xiang Ji was delighted and grasped the basic concepts, but refused to complete his studies.

context.previous: 劍一人敵，不足學，學萬人敵。」
context.next: 項梁嘗有櫟陽逮，乃請蘄獄掾曹咎書抵櫟陽獄掾司馬欣，以故事得已。

translations.chinese: 項梁嘗有櫟陽逮，乃請蘄獄掾曹咎書抵櫟陽獄掾司馬欣，以故事得已。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang once had a Queyang arrest case, so he requested the Qi prison clerk Cao Jiu to write a letter to the Queyang prison clerk Sima Xin, and through precedents got it resolved.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang once faced arrest in Queyang. He asked the prison official Cao Jiu from Qi to write to the prison official Sima Xin in Queyang, and through legal precedents the matter was resolved.

context.previous: 於是項梁乃教籍兵法，籍大喜，略知其意，又不肯竟學。
context.next: 項梁殺人，與籍避仇於吳中。

translations.chinese: 項梁殺人，與籍避仇於吳中。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang killed someone, and together with Ji fled their enemies to Wu region.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang had killed a man, so he and Xiang Ji fled to the Wu region to escape their enemies.

context.previous: 項梁嘗有櫟陽逮，乃請蘄獄掾曹咎書抵櫟陽獄掾司馬欣，以故事得已。
context.next: 吳中賢士大夫皆出項梁下。

translations.chinese: 吳中賢士大夫皆出項梁下。
translations.literal: The worthy scholars and officials in Wu all served under Xiang Liang.
translations.idiomatic: All the worthy gentlemen and officials in the Wu region acknowledged Xiang Liang as their leader.

context.previous: 項梁殺人，與籍避仇於吳中。
context.next: 每吳中有大繇役及喪，項梁常為主辦，陰以兵法部勒賓客及子弟，以是知其能。

translations.chinese: 每吳中有大繇役及喪，項梁常為主辦，陰以兵法部勒賓客及子弟，以是知其能。
translations.literal: Whenever there were great labor services or funerals in Wu, Xiang Liang always took charge of organizing them, secretly using military methods to organize the guests and younger relatives, and through this people knew his abilities.
translations.idiomatic: Whenever the Wu region had major labor projects or funerals, Xiang Liang always took charge. Secretly he organized the guests and young men using military discipline, and through this people recognized his capabilities.

context.previous: 吳中賢士大夫皆出項梁下。
context.next: 秦始皇帝游會稽，渡浙江，梁與籍俱觀。

translations.chinese: 秦始皇帝游會稽，渡浙江，梁與籍俱觀。
translations.literal: When the First Emperor of Qin toured Kuaiji and crossed the Zhejiang, Liang and Ji both watched.
translations.idiomatic: When Qin Shi Huang toured Kuaiji and crossed the Zhejiang River, both Xiang Liang and Xiang Ji watched from the crowd.

context.previous: 每吳中有大繇役及喪，項梁常為主辦，陰以兵法部勒賓客及子弟，以是知其能。
context.next: 籍曰：「彼可取而代也。」

translations.chinese: 籍曰：「彼可取而代也。」
translations.literal: Ji said: 'He can be taken and replaced.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji said, 'That man can be seized and replaced.'

context.previous: 秦始皇帝游會稽，渡浙江，梁與籍俱觀。
context.next: 梁掩其口，曰：「毋妄言，族矣！」

translations.chinese: 梁掩其口，曰：「毋妄言，族矣！」
translations.literal: Liang covered his mouth, saying: 'Don't speak recklessly, you'll destroy the whole clan!'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang clapped his hand over Xiang Ji's mouth. 'Don't talk nonsense,' he said. 'You'll get our whole clan executed!'

context.previous: 籍曰：「彼可取而代也。」
context.next: 梁以此奇籍。

translations.chinese: 梁以此奇籍。
translations.literal: Liang considered Ji extraordinary because of this.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang regarded Xiang Ji as extraordinary because of this incident.

context.previous: 梁掩其口，曰：「毋妄言，族矣！」
context.next: 籍長八尺餘，力能扛鼎，才氣過人，雖吳中子弟皆已憚籍矣。

translations.chinese: 籍長八尺餘，力能扛鼎，才氣過人，雖吳中子弟皆已憚籍矣。
translations.literal: Ji was over eight chi tall, had the strength to lift tripods, and his talent and spirit surpassed others. Even the young men of Wu already feared Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji stood over eight feet tall and had the strength to lift a bronze tripod. His talent and spirit were extraordinary. Even the young men of Wu feared him.

context.previous: 梁以此奇籍。

translations.chinese: 秦二世元年七月，陳涉等起大澤中。
translations.literal: In the first year of Qin Ershi, seventh month, Chen She and others rose up in Daze.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month of the first year of Qin Ershi's reign, Chen She and others rose in rebellion from the Great Swamp.

context.next: 其九月，會稽守通謂梁曰：「江西皆反，此亦天亡秦之時也。

translations.chinese: 其九月，會稽守通謂梁曰：「江西皆反，此亦天亡秦之時也。
translations.literal: In the ninth month, the Kuaiji governor Tong said to Liang: 'West of the Jiang are all rebelling, this is also the time when Heaven intends to destroy Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, the governor of Kuaiji, Yin Tong, said to Xiang Liang, 'Everyone west of the Yangtze has rebelled. This is Heaven's time to destroy Qin.'

context.previous: 秦二世元年七月，陳涉等起大澤中。
context.next: 吾聞先即制人，後則為人所制。

translations.chinese: 吾聞先即制人，後則為人所制。
translations.literal: I have heard that he who strikes first controls others, he who strikes later is controlled by others.
translations.idiomatic: I've heard it said that those who strike first control others, while those who strike later are controlled.

context.previous: 其九月，會稽守通謂梁曰：「江西皆反，此亦天亡秦之時也。
context.next: 吾欲發兵，使公及桓楚將。」

translations.chinese: 吾欲發兵，使公及桓楚將。」
translations.literal: I wish to raise troops, and have you and Huan Chu command them.'
translations.idiomatic: I intend to raise an army and put you and Huan Chu in command.'

context.previous: 吾聞先即制人，後則為人所制。
context.next: 是時桓楚亡在澤中。

translations.chinese: 是時桓楚亡在澤中。
translations.literal: At this time Huan Chu was hiding in the marshes.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Huan Chu was in hiding in the marshes.

context.previous: 吾欲發兵，使公及桓楚將。」
context.next: 梁曰：「桓楚亡，人莫知其處，獨籍知之耳。」

translations.chinese: 梁曰：「桓楚亡，人莫知其處，獨籍知之耳。」
translations.literal: Liang said: 'Huan Chu is in hiding, no one knows his location, only Ji knows it.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang replied, 'Huan Chu is in hiding. No one knows where he is—only Xiang Ji does.'

context.previous: 是時桓楚亡在澤中。
context.next: 梁乃出，誡籍持劍居外待。

translations.chinese: 梁乃出，誡籍持劍居外待。
translations.literal: Liang then went out and instructed Ji to hold his sword and wait outside.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang stepped out and told Xiang Ji to stand guard outside with his sword drawn.

context.previous: 梁曰：「桓楚亡，人莫知其處，獨籍知之耳。」
context.next: 梁復入，與守坐，曰：「請召籍，使受命召桓楚。」

translations.chinese: 梁復入，與守坐，曰：「請召籍，使受命召桓楚。」
translations.literal: Liang entered again, sat with the governor, and said: 'Please summon Ji so he can receive orders to summon Huan Chu.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang returned inside and sat with the governor. 'Please summon Xiang Ji,' he said, 'so he can receive orders to call up Huan Chu.'

context.previous: 梁乃出，誡籍持劍居外待。
context.next: 守曰：「諾。」

translations.chinese: 守曰：「諾。」
translations.literal: The governor said: "Very well."
translations.idiomatic: The governor agreed.

context.previous: 梁復入，與守坐，曰：「請召籍，使受命召桓楚。」
context.next: 梁召籍入。

translations.chinese: 梁召籍入。
translations.literal: Liang summoned Ji to enter.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang called Xiang Ji inside.

context.previous: 守曰：「諾。」
context.next: 須臾，梁眴籍曰：「可行矣！」

translations.chinese: 須臾，梁眴籍曰：「可行矣！」
translations.literal: After a moment, Liang winked at Ji and said: "You may proceed!"
translations.idiomatic: A moment later, Xiang Liang winked at Xiang Ji and said, "Do it!"

context.previous: 梁召籍入。
context.next: 於是籍遂拔劍斬守頭。

translations.chinese: 於是籍遂拔劍斬守頭。
translations.literal: Thereupon Ji drew his sword and cut off the governor's head.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji then drew his sword and beheaded the governor.

context.previous: 須臾，梁眴籍曰：「可行矣！」
context.next: 項梁持守頭，佩其印綬。

translations.chinese: 項梁持守頭，佩其印綬。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang held the governor's head and wore his seal cord.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang took the governor's head and put on his official seal.

context.previous: 於是籍遂拔劍斬守頭。
context.next: 門下大驚，擾亂，籍所擊殺數十百人。

translations.chinese: 門下大驚，擾亂，籍所擊殺數十百人。
translations.literal: The gate guards were greatly alarmed, Ji struck and killed several dozen people.
translations.idiomatic: The guards at the gate were terrified. Xiang Ji struck down dozens of them.

context.previous: 項梁持守頭，佩其印綬。
context.next: 一府中皆慴伏，莫敢起。

translations.chinese: 一府中皆慴伏，莫敢起。
translations.literal: Everyone in the headquarters was terrified and submissive, no one dared rise.
translations.idiomatic: Everyone in the headquarters was cowed into submission. No one dared to resist.

context.previous: 門下大驚，擾亂，籍所擊殺數十百人。
context.next: 梁乃召故所知豪吏，諭以所為起大事，遂舉吳中兵。

translations.chinese: 梁乃召故所知豪吏，諭以所為起大事，遂舉吳中兵。
translations.literal: Liang then summoned the influential officials he had known before, and explained to them the great undertaking they were starting.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang summoned the powerful officials he knew and explained the great rebellion they were launching.

context.previous: 一府中皆慴伏，莫敢起。
context.next: 使人收下縣，得精兵八千人。

translations.chinese: 使人收下縣，得精兵八千人。
translations.literal: They then raised troops from Wu region, and sent people to gather from the subordinate counties, obtaining eight thousand elite soldiers.
translations.idiomatic: They raised an army from the Wu region and sent recruiters to the neighboring counties, gathering eight thousand crack troops.

context.previous: 梁乃召故所知豪吏，諭以所為起大事，遂舉吳中兵。
context.next: 梁部署吳中豪傑為校尉、候、司馬。

translations.chinese: 梁部署吳中豪傑為校尉、候、司馬。
translations.literal: Liang appointed the heroic figures of Wu as colonels, scouts, and adjutants.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang appointed the leading men of Wu as officers—colonels, scouts, and adjutants.

context.previous: 使人收下縣，得精兵八千人。
context.next: 有一人不得用，自言於梁。

translations.chinese: 有一人不得用，自言於梁。
translations.literal: There was one person who did not get an official position, and spoke to Liang about it himself.
translations.idiomatic: One man who didn't receive an appointment complained directly to Xiang Liang.

context.previous: 梁部署吳中豪傑為校尉、候、司馬。
context.next: 梁曰：「前時某喪使公主某事，不能辦，以此不任用公。」

translations.chinese: 梁曰：「前時某喪使公主某事，不能辦，以此不任用公。」
translations.literal: Liang said: "At such-and-such a time, for such-and-such a matter, I sent Merchant So-and-so, and he got heavy bribes, so I had no choice but to give him the position."
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang replied, "At a certain time, for a certain matter, I sent Merchant X on business. He received heavy bribes, so I had to give him the appointment."

context.previous: 有一人不得用，自言於梁。
context.next: 眾乃皆伏。

translations.chinese: 眾乃皆伏。
translations.literal: Thereupon Ji cut off the merchant's head to make an example, saying: "You all follow the army: the first to arrive become generals, next become adjutants, later ones become soldiers, those who wish to leave may do so."
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji then beheaded the merchant as an example. "All of you join the army," he announced. "First to arrive become generals, next become adjutants, last become common soldiers. Those who wish to leave may go."

context.previous: 梁曰：「前時某喪使公主某事，不能辦，以此不任用公。」
context.next: 於是梁為會稽守，籍為裨將，徇下縣。

translations.chinese: 於是梁為會稽守，籍為裨將，徇下縣。
translations.literal: Thereupon those who wished to leave firmly stayed, those who wished to stay left.
translations.idiomatic: Those who wanted to leave stayed put, while those who wanted to stay departed.

context.previous: 眾乃皆伏。

translations.chinese: 廣陵人召平於是為陳王徇廣陵，未能下。
translations.literal: Ji said: "What sort of person is a stalwart warrior?"
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji asked, "What kind of man is a true warrior?"

context.next: 聞陳王敗走，秦兵又且至，乃渡江矯陳王命，拜梁為楚王上柱國。

translations.chinese: 聞陳王敗走，秦兵又且至，乃渡江矯陳王命，拜梁為楚王上柱國。
translations.literal: He stripped off his clothes and asked to be tattooed where the sword had struck.
translations.idiomatic: He bared his body and asked to be tattooed at the spot where the sword had cut him.

context.previous: 廣陵人召平於是為陳王徇廣陵，未能下。
context.next: 曰：「江東已定，急引兵西擊秦。」

translations.chinese: 曰：「江東已定，急引兵西擊秦。」
translations.literal: He said: "Jiangdong is already settled; urgently lead troops west to attack Qin."
translations.idiomatic: He declared: "Jiangdong is now pacified. Lead the troops west immediately to attack Qin."

context.previous: 聞陳王敗走，秦兵又且至，乃渡江矯陳王命，拜梁為楚王上柱國。
context.next: 項梁乃以八千人渡江而西。

translations.chinese: 項梁乃以八千人渡江而西。
translations.literal: At this time, in all the commanderies and counties that suffered under Qin officials, they all punished their chief officials and killed them to respond to Chen She.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, in all the commanderies and counties that suffered under Qin rule, the people executed their local officials to join Chen She's rebellion.

context.previous: 曰：「江東已定，急引兵西擊秦。」
context.next: 聞陳嬰已下東陽，使使欲與連和俱西。

translations.chinese: 聞陳嬰已下東陽，使使欲與連和俱西。
translations.literal: They then made Liang governor of Kuaiji, and Ji assistant general.
translations.idiomatic: They appointed Xiang Liang as governor of Kuaiji and Xiang Ji as his deputy general.

context.previous: 項梁乃以八千人渡江而西。
context.next: 陳嬰者，故東陽令史，居縣中，素信謹，稱為長者。

translations.chinese: 陳嬰者，故東陽令史，居縣中，素信謹，稱為長者。
translations.literal: They toured the subordinate counties.
translations.idiomatic: They marched through the neighboring counties.

context.previous: 聞陳嬰已下東陽，使使欲與連和俱西。
context.next: 東陽少年殺其令，相聚數千人，欲置長，無適用，乃請陳嬰。

translations.chinese: 東陽少年殺其令，相聚數千人，欲置長，無適用，乃請陳嬰。
translations.literal: The Guangling man Zhao Ping was then campaigning for the King of Chen at Guangling, but could not conquer it.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Ping of Guangling was at this time campaigning for the King of Chen at Guangling, but failed to take it.

context.previous: 陳嬰者，故東陽令史，居縣中，素信謹，稱為長者。
context.next: 嬰謝不能，遂彊立嬰為長，縣中從者得二萬人。

translations.chinese: 嬰謝不能，遂彊立嬰為長，縣中從者得二萬人。
translations.literal: Liang sent Ji to attack Guangling, and he broke it.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang sent Xiang Ji to attack Guangling, and he captured it.

context.previous: 東陽少年殺其令，相聚數千人，欲置長，無適用，乃請陳嬰。
context.next: 少年欲立嬰便為王，異軍蒼頭特起。

translations.chinese: 少年欲立嬰便為王，異軍蒼頭特起。
translations.literal: He returned and reported to Liang, who was greatly pleased and entrusted all military affairs to Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji returned and reported to Xiang Liang, who was delighted and put Xiang Ji in charge of all military operations.

context.previous: 嬰謝不能，遂彊立嬰為長，縣中從者得二萬人。
context.next: 陳嬰母謂嬰曰：「自我為汝家婦，未嘗聞汝先古之有貴者。

translations.chinese: 陳嬰母謂嬰曰：「自我為汝家婦，未嘗聞汝先古之有貴者。
translations.literal: Ji then led troops to attack Yuanfu.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji then led his troops to attack Yuanfu.

context.previous: 少年欲立嬰便為王，異軍蒼頭特起。
context.next: 今暴得大名，不祥。

translations.chinese: 今暴得大名，不祥。
translations.literal: Now suddenly gaining great fame is inauspicious.
translations.idiomatic: Suddenly gaining such great fame now is an ill omen.

context.previous: 陳嬰母謂嬰曰：「自我為汝家婦，未嘗聞汝先古之有貴者。
context.next: 不如有所屬，事成猶得封侯，事敗易以亡，非世所指名也。」

translations.chinese: 不如有所屬，事成猶得封侯，事敗易以亡，非世所指名也。」
translations.literal: It would be better to have some affiliation. If the matter succeeds, one can still receive a marquess title; if it fails, it is easy to flee, and one won't be pointed out by the world.
translations.idiomatic: Better to align yourself with someone. If the venture succeeds, you can still earn a marquessate; if it fails, you can easily escape unnoticed, without becoming a marked man.

context.previous: 今暴得大名，不祥。
context.next: 嬰乃不敢為王。

translations.chinese: 嬰乃不敢為王。
translations.literal: Ying then dared not become king.
translations.idiomatic: Ying therefore dared not become king.

context.previous: 不如有所屬，事成猶得封侯，事敗易以亡，非世所指名也。」
context.next: 謂其軍吏曰：「項氏世世將家，有名於楚。

translations.chinese: 謂其軍吏曰：「項氏世世將家，有名於楚。
translations.literal: He said to his army officers: 'The Xiang clan has been military commanders for generations and has a reputation in Chu.
translations.idiomatic: He told his officers: 'The Xiang family has been generals for generations with a great reputation in Chu.'

context.previous: 嬰乃不敢為王。
context.next: 今欲舉大事，將非其人，不可。

translations.chinese: 今欲舉大事，將非其人，不可。
translations.literal: Now desiring to undertake great matters, if the commander is not the right person, it cannot be done.
translations.idiomatic: Now that we want to undertake great deeds, if the commander isn't the right man, it simply won't work.

context.previous: 謂其軍吏曰：「項氏世世將家，有名於楚。
context.next: 我倚名族，亡秦必矣。」

translations.chinese: 我倚名族，亡秦必矣。」
translations.literal: I rely on a famous clan; destroying Qin is certain.
translations.idiomatic: Relying on this famous clan, destroying Qin is assured.

context.previous: 今欲舉大事，將非其人，不可。
context.next: 於是眾從其言，以兵屬項梁。

translations.chinese: 於是眾從其言，以兵屬項梁。
translations.literal: Thereupon the multitude followed his words and attached their troops to Xiang Liang.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the crowd followed his advice and placed their troops under Xiang Liang's command.

context.previous: 我倚名族，亡秦必矣。」
context.next: 項梁渡淮，黥布、蒲將軍亦以兵屬焉。

translations.chinese: 項梁渡淮，黥布、蒲將軍亦以兵屬焉。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang crossed the Huai, and Ying Bu and the Pu general also attached their troops to him.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang crossed the Huai River, and Generals Ying Bu and Pu also joined him with their troops.

context.previous: 於是眾從其言，以兵屬項梁。
context.next: 凡六七萬人，軍下邳。

translations.chinese: 凡六七萬人，軍下邳。
translations.literal: In total sixty to seventy thousand men, they camped at Xiapi.
translations.idiomatic: In all, sixty to seventy thousand men camped at Xiapi.

context.previous: 項梁渡淮，黥布、蒲將軍亦以兵屬焉。

translations.chinese: 當是時，秦嘉已立景駒為楚王，軍彭城東，欲距項梁。
translations.literal: At this time, Qin Jia had already established Jing Ju as King of Chu and was camped east of Pengcheng, desiring to oppose Xiang Liang.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Qin Jia had already installed Jing Ju as King of Chu and was encamped east of Pengcheng, intending to oppose Xiang Liang.

context.next: 項梁謂軍吏曰：「陳王先首事，戰不利，未聞所在。

translations.chinese: 項梁謂軍吏曰：「陳王先首事，戰不利，未聞所在。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang said to his army officers: 'King Chen first started the affair; the battle was unfavorable, and we have not heard where he is.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang told his officers: 'King Chen was the first to raise the standard. The battle went badly, and we've heard nothing of his whereabouts.'

context.previous: 當是時，秦嘉已立景駒為楚王，軍彭城東，欲距項梁。
context.next: 今秦嘉倍陳王而立景駒，逆無道。」

translations.chinese: 今秦嘉倍陳王而立景駒，逆無道。」
translations.literal: Now Qin Jia has betrayed King Chen and established Jing Ju; this is rebellion and lacks the Way.
translations.idiomatic: Now Qin Jia has betrayed King Chen and set up Jing Ju instead. This is rebellion and utterly without principle.

context.previous: 項梁謂軍吏曰：「陳王先首事，戰不利，未聞所在。
context.next: 乃進兵擊秦嘉。

translations.chinese: 乃進兵擊秦嘉。
translations.literal: They then advanced troops and attacked Qin Jia.
translations.idiomatic: They then advanced their troops and attacked Qin Jia.

context.previous: 今秦嘉倍陳王而立景駒，逆無道。」
context.next: 秦嘉軍敗走，追之至胡陵。

translations.chinese: 秦嘉軍敗走，追之至胡陵。
translations.literal: Qin Jia's army was defeated and fled; they pursued him to Hu Ling.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Jia's army was defeated and fled. They pursued him all the way to Hu Ling.

context.previous: 乃進兵擊秦嘉。
context.next: 嘉還戰一日，嘉死，軍降。

translations.chinese: 嘉還戰一日，嘉死，軍降。
translations.literal: Jia turned back and fought for one day; Jia died, and the army surrendered.
translations.idiomatic: Jia turned back and fought for another day. Jia was killed, and his army surrendered.

context.previous: 秦嘉軍敗走，追之至胡陵。
context.next: 景駒走死梁地。

translations.chinese: 景駒走死梁地。
translations.literal: Jing Ju fled and died in Liang territory.
translations.idiomatic: Jing Ju fled and met his death in Liang territory.

context.previous: 嘉還戰一日，嘉死，軍降。
context.next: 項梁已并秦嘉軍，軍胡陵，將引軍而西。

translations.chinese: 項梁已并秦嘉軍，軍胡陵，將引軍而西。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang had already absorbed Qin Jia's army, was camped at Hu Ling, and was about to lead the army west.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang had already incorporated Qin Jia's army. He was encamped at Hu Ling and preparing to lead his forces westward.

context.previous: 景駒走死梁地。
context.next: 章邯軍至栗，項梁使別將朱雞石、餘樊君與戰。

translations.chinese: 章邯軍至栗，項梁使別將朱雞石、餘樊君與戰。
translations.literal: Zhang Han's army reached Li, Xiang Liang sent deputy generals Zhu Ji Shi and Yu Fan Jun to fight them.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Han's army reached Li. Xiang Liang sent his deputy generals Zhu Jishi and Yu Fanjun to engage them in battle.

context.previous: 項梁已并秦嘉軍，軍胡陵，將引軍而西。
context.next: 餘樊君死。

translations.chinese: 餘樊君死。
translations.literal: Yu Fan Jun died.
translations.idiomatic: Yu Fanjun was killed.

context.previous: 章邯軍至栗，項梁使別將朱雞石、餘樊君與戰。
context.next: 朱雞石軍敗，亡走胡陵。

translations.chinese: 朱雞石軍敗，亡走胡陵。
translations.literal: Zhu Ji Shi's army was defeated, he fled to Hu Ling.
translations.idiomatic: Zhu Jishi's army was defeated, and he fled to Hu Ling.

context.previous: 餘樊君死。
context.next: 項梁乃引兵入薛，誅雞石。

translations.chinese: 項梁乃引兵入薛，誅雞石。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang then led troops into Xue and executed Ji Shi.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang then led his troops into Xue and executed Jishi.

context.previous: 朱雞石軍敗，亡走胡陵。
context.next: 項梁前使項羽別攻襄城，襄城堅守不下。

translations.chinese: 項梁前使項羽別攻襄城，襄城堅守不下。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang had previously sent Xiang Yu separately to attack Xiangcheng, but Xiangcheng held out firmly and would not surrender.
translations.idiomatic: Earlier, Xiang Liang had sent Xiang Yu separately to attack Xiangcheng, but the city held out firmly and refused to surrender.

context.previous: 項梁乃引兵入薛，誅雞石。
context.next: 已拔，皆阬之。

translations.chinese: 已拔，皆阬之。
translations.literal: Once captured, he buried them all alive.
translations.idiomatic: Once the city was taken, he buried all the defenders alive.

context.previous: 項梁前使項羽別攻襄城，襄城堅守不下。
context.next: 還報項梁。

translations.chinese: 還報項梁。
translations.literal: He returned and reported to Xiang Liang.
translations.idiomatic: He returned and reported back to Xiang Liang.

context.previous: 已拔，皆阬之。
context.next: 項梁聞陳王定死，召諸別將會薛計事。

translations.chinese: 項梁聞陳王定死，召諸別將會薛計事。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang heard that King Chen had certainly died, and summoned all the deputy generals to assemble at Xue to discuss matters.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang heard that King Chen had definitely died. He summoned all his deputy generals to assemble at Xue for a council of war.

context.previous: 還報項梁。
context.next: 此時沛公亦起沛，往焉。

translations.chinese: 此時沛公亦起沛，往焉。
translations.literal: At this time, Duke Pei had also risen at Pei and went there.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, the Duke of Pei had also risen in rebellion at Pei and went to join them.

context.previous: 項梁聞陳王定死，召諸別將會薛計事。

translations.chinese: 居鄛人范增，年七十，素居家，好奇計，往說項梁曰：「陳勝敗碧當。
translations.literal: The man from Ju Xiong, Fan Zeng, aged seventy, usually stayed at home, was fond of unusual strategies, went to persuade Xiang Liang saying: 'Chen Sheng's defeat was as it should be.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Zeng from Ju Xiong, aged seventy, normally kept to his home but loved devising clever strategies. He went to persuade Xiang Liang: 'Chen Sheng's defeat was inevitable.'

context.next: 夫秦滅六國，楚最無罪。

translations.chinese: 夫秦滅六國，楚最無罪。
translations.literal: As for Qin destroying the six states, Chu was the most innocent.
translations.idiomatic: When Qin destroyed the six states, Chu was the most innocent of all.

context.previous: 居鄛人范增，年七十，素居家，好奇計，往說項梁曰：「陳勝敗碧當。
context.next: 自懷王入秦不反，楚人憐之至今，故楚南公曰『楚雖三戶，亡秦必楚』也。

translations.chinese: 自懷王入秦不反，楚人憐之至今，故楚南公曰『楚雖三戶，亡秦必楚』也。
translations.literal: Ever since King Huai entered Qin and never returned, the Chu people have pitied him to this day, hence the Chu Nan Gong said 'Even if Chu has only three households, destroying Qin must be done by Chu.'
translations.idiomatic: Ever since King Huai entered Qin and never came back, the Chu people have pitied him to this day. That's why Chu Nangong said, 'Even if Chu has only three families left, destroying Qin must be Chu's mission.'

context.previous: 夫秦滅六國，楚最無罪。
context.next: 今陳勝首事，不立楚後而自立，其勢不長。

translations.chinese: 今陳勝首事，不立楚後而自立，其勢不長。
translations.literal: Now Chen Sheng first raised the standard but did not establish a Chu descendant and instead established himself; his position will not last long.
translations.idiomatic: Now Chen Sheng was the first to raise the standard, but instead of establishing a descendant of Chu, he set himself up. His position won't last long.

context.previous: 自懷王入秦不反，楚人憐之至今，故楚南公曰『楚雖三戶，亡秦必楚』也。
context.next: 今君起江東，楚蜂午之將皆爭附君者，以君世世楚將，為能復立楚之後也。」

translations.chinese: 今君起江東，楚蜂午之將皆爭附君者，以君世世楚將，為能復立楚之後也。」
translations.literal: Now you have risen in Jiangdong, and all the generals of Chu who are swarming like bees are contending to attach themselves to you, because you are generation after generation Chu generals, and are able to re-establish Chu descendants.
translations.idiomatic: Now that you have risen in Jiangdong, all the Chu generals swarming like bees are contending to join you. This is because your family has been Chu generals for generations, and you are capable of restoring the Chu royal line.

context.previous: 今陳勝首事，不立楚後而自立，其勢不長。
context.next: 於是項梁然其言，乃求楚懷王孫心民閒，為人牧羊，立以為楚懷王，從民所望也。

translations.chinese: 於是項梁然其言，乃求楚懷王孫心民閒，為人牧羊，立以為楚懷王，從民所望也。
translations.literal: Thereupon Xiang Liang agreed with his words, and sought King Huai of Chu's grandson Xin among the common people, who was herding sheep for someone, and established him as King Huai of Chu, following what the people wished.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang accepted this advice. He sought out King Huai of Chu's grandson Xin among the common folk—he was working as a shepherd—and established him as King Huai of Chu, fulfilling the people's hopes.

context.previous: 今君起江東，楚蜂午之將皆爭附君者，以君世世楚將，為能復立楚之後也。」
context.next: 陳嬰為楚上柱國，封五縣，與懷王都盱臺。

translations.chinese: 陳嬰為楚上柱國，封五縣，與懷王都盱臺。
translations.literal: Chen Ying became Chu's Supreme Pillar of State, was enfeoffed with five counties, and together with King Huai made Xutai their capital.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Ying was appointed Chu's Supreme Pillar of State and enfeoffed with five counties. Together with King Huai, they established their capital at Xutai.

context.previous: 於是項梁然其言，乃求楚懷王孫心民閒，為人牧羊，立以為楚懷王，從民所望也。
context.next: 項梁自號為武信君。

translations.chinese: 項梁自號為武信君。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang styled himself as Lord Wu Xin.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang took the title Lord Wu Xin for himself.

context.previous: 陳嬰為楚上柱國，封五縣，與懷王都盱臺。

translations.chinese: 居數月，引兵攻亢父，與齊田榮、司馬龍且軍救東阿，大破秦軍於東阿。
translations.literal: After several months, he led troops to attack Kangfu, and together with the Qi armies of Tian Rong and Sima Longqu came to relieve Dong'a, greatly defeating the Qin army at Dong'a.
translations.idiomatic: Several months later, he led his troops to attack Kangfu. Joining forces with Tian Rong and Sima Longqu's Qi armies, they relieved Dong'a and inflicted a major defeat on the Qin forces there.

context.next: 田榮即引兵歸，逐其王假。

translations.chinese: 田榮即引兵歸，逐其王假。
translations.literal: Tian Rong then led his troops back and drove out their king Jia.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong then led his troops back home and expelled their king Jia.

context.previous: 居數月，引兵攻亢父，與齊田榮、司馬龍且軍救東阿，大破秦軍於東阿。
context.next: 假亡走楚。

translations.chinese: 假亡走楚。
translations.literal: Jia fled to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Jia fled to the state of Chu.

context.previous: 田榮即引兵歸，逐其王假。
context.next: 假相田角亡走趙。

translations.chinese: 假相田角亡走趙。
translations.literal: Jia's chancellor Tian Jiao fled to Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Jia's chancellor Tian Jiao fled to the state of Zhao.

context.previous: 假亡走楚。
context.next: 角弟田閒故齊將，居趙不敢歸。

translations.chinese: 角弟田閒故齊將，居趙不敢歸。
translations.literal: Jiao's younger brother Tian Jian was formerly a Qi general, stayed in Zhao and dared not return.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Jiao's younger brother Tian Jian, formerly a Qi general, remained in Zhao and dared not return home.

context.previous: 假相田角亡走趙。
context.next: 田榮立田儋子市為齊王。

translations.chinese: 田榮立田儋子市為齊王。
translations.literal: Tian Rong established Tian Dan's son Shi as King of Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong installed Tian Dan's son Shi as King of Qi.

context.previous: 角弟田閒故齊將，居趙不敢歸。
context.next: 項梁已破東阿下軍，遂追秦軍。

translations.chinese: 項梁已破東阿下軍，遂追秦軍。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang, having defeated the Dong'a army, then pursued the Qin army.
translations.idiomatic: Having defeated the army at Dong'a, Xiang Liang then pursued the Qin forces.

context.previous: 田榮立田儋子市為齊王。
context.next: 數使使趣齊兵，欲與俱西。

translations.chinese: 數使使趣齊兵，欲與俱西。
translations.literal: He repeatedly sent envoys to hurry the Qi troops, desiring to go west together with them.
translations.idiomatic: He repeatedly sent envoys to urge the Qi troops to hurry, wanting to advance westward together with them.

context.previous: 項梁已破東阿下軍，遂追秦軍。
context.next: 田榮曰：「楚殺田假，趙殺田角、田閒，乃發兵。」

translations.chinese: 田榮曰：「楚殺田假，趙殺田角、田閒，乃發兵。」
translations.literal: Tian Rong said: 'Chu killed Tian Jia, Zhao killed Tian Jiao and Tian Jian, then I will send troops.'
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong said, 'Only after Chu kills Tian Jia and Zhao kills Tian Jiao and Tian Jian will I send troops.'

context.previous: 數使使趣齊兵，欲與俱西。
context.next: 項梁曰：「田假為與國之王，窮來從我，不忍殺之。」

translations.chinese: 項梁曰：「田假為與國之王，窮來從我，不忍殺之。」
translations.literal: Xiang Liang said: 'Tian Jia was the king of an allied state, came to me in distress, I could not bear to kill him.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang replied, 'Tian Jia was the ruler of an allied state. He came to me when he was desperate. I could not bring myself to kill him.'

context.previous: 田榮曰：「楚殺田假，趙殺田角、田閒，乃發兵。」
context.next: 趙亦不殺田角、田閒以市於齊。

translations.chinese: 趙亦不殺田角、田閒以市於齊。
translations.literal: Zhao also did not kill Tian Jiao and Tian Jian in order to trade with Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao also spared Tian Jiao and Tian Jian in order to maintain good relations with Qi.

context.previous: 項梁曰：「田假為與國之王，窮來從我，不忍殺之。」
context.next: 齊遂不肯發兵助楚。

translations.chinese: 齊遂不肯發兵助楚。
translations.literal: Qi ultimately refused to send troops to help Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Qi ultimately refused to send troops to aid Chu.

context.previous: 趙亦不殺田角、田閒以市於齊。
context.next: 項梁使沛公及項羽別攻城陽，屠之。

translations.chinese: 項梁使沛公及項羽別攻城陽，屠之。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang sent the Duke of Pei and Xiang Yu separately to attack Chengyang, and they slaughtered the population.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang sent the Duke of Pei and Xiang Yu separately to attack Chengyang. They slaughtered its inhabitants.

context.previous: 齊遂不肯發兵助楚。
context.next: 西破秦軍濮陽東，秦兵收入濮陽。

translations.chinese: 西破秦軍濮陽東，秦兵收入濮陽。
translations.literal: They defeated the Qin army east of Puyang, and the Qin troops withdrew into Puyang.
translations.idiomatic: They defeated the Qin army east of Puyang, forcing the Qin troops to withdraw into the city.

context.previous: 項梁使沛公及項羽別攻城陽，屠之。
context.next: 沛公、項羽乃攻定陶。

translations.chinese: 沛公、項羽乃攻定陶。
translations.literal: The Duke of Pei and Xiang Yu then attacked Dingtao.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Pei and Xiang Yu then launched an attack on Dingtao.

context.previous: 西破秦軍濮陽東，秦兵收入濮陽。
context.next: 定陶未下，去，西略地至雝丘，大破秦軍，斬李由。

translations.chinese: 定陶未下，去，西略地至雝丘，大破秦軍，斬李由。
translations.literal: Dingtao did not fall, so they left and went west, raiding territory until they reached Chongqiu, where they greatly defeated the Qin army and beheaded Li You.
translations.idiomatic: Dingtao did not surrender, so they departed and marched west, raiding territory until they reached Chongqiu. There they decisively defeated the Qin army and beheaded Li You.

context.previous: 沛公、項羽乃攻定陶。
context.next: 還攻外黃，外黃未下。

translations.chinese: 還攻外黃，外黃未下。
translations.literal: They returned and attacked Waihuang, but Waihuang did not fall.
translations.idiomatic: They turned back and attacked Waihuang, but the city held out.

context.previous: 定陶未下，去，西略地至雝丘，大破秦軍，斬李由。

translations.chinese: 項梁起東阿，西，（北）［比］至定陶，再破秦軍，項羽等又斬李由，益輕秦，有驕色。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang set out from Dong'a, went west, and arrived at Dingtao, where he defeated the Qin army again. Xiang Yu and others beheaded Li You again. They increasingly looked down on Qin and showed arrogant expressions.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang marched from Dong'a westward and reached Dingtao, where he defeated the Qin army once more. Xiang Yu and his men beheaded Li You again. They grew increasingly contemptuous of Qin and displayed arrogant expressions.

context.next: 宋義乃諫項梁曰：「戰勝而將驕卒惰者敗。

translations.chinese: 宋義乃諫項梁曰：「戰勝而將驕卒惰者敗。
translations.literal: Song Yi then admonished Xiang Liang, saying: 'When generals become arrogant and troops lazy after victory, they will be defeated.

translations.idiomatic: Along the way, he encountered the Qi envoy Lord Gao Ling Xian, who asked: 'Are you going to see Lord Wu Xin?'

translations.idiomatic: Song Yi replied: 'Yes.'

translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Pei and Xiang Yu conferred together: 'Now that Xiang Liang's army has been broken, our soldiers are terrified.'

translations.idiomatic: At this juncture, Zhao Xie served as king, Chen Yu as general, Zhang Er as chancellor, and they all fled into the city of Julu.

translations.idiomatic: He appointed Lü Chen as Minister of Works and his father Lü Qing as Prime Minister.

translations.idiomatic: He appointed the Duke of Pei as prefect of Dang commandery, enfeoffed him as Marquis of Wu'an, and gave him command of the Dang commandery troops.

translations.literal: Initially, the Qi envoy Lord Gao Ling Xian whom Song Yi had encountered was in the Chu army. He saw the Chu king and said: 'Song Yi predicted that Lord Wu Xin's army would certainly be defeated. Several days later, the army indeed was defeated.
translations.idiomatic: Originally, the Qi envoy Lord Gao Ling Xian, whom Song Yi had met on the road, was serving in the Chu army. He approached the Chu king and said: 'Song Yi foresaw that Lord Wu Xin's army would surely be defeated. A few days later, the army indeed suffered defeat.'

translations.literal: Before the troops even fought, he foresaw the signs of defeat. This can be called understanding military affairs.'
translations.idiomatic: Even before the battle was joined, he perceived the omens of defeat. This can truly be called understanding warfare.'

translations.literal: They marched to Anyang and remained there for forty-six days without advancing.
translations.idiomatic: They proceeded to Anyang and halted there for forty-six days, making no further progress.

translations.idiomatic: If they lose, we can lead our troops westward in a triumphal march and will surely conquer Qin.

translations.literal: As for wearing armor and wielding sharp weapons, Yi is not as good as you;

translations.idiomatic: But when it comes to sitting and devising strategies, you are no match for me.'

translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he issued an order throughout the army: 'Execute anyone who is fierce as a tiger, stubborn as a sheep, greedy as a wolf, or too strong-willed to follow orders.'

translations.idiomatic: He then dispatched his son Song Xiang to serve as chancellor of Qi, personally escorting him as far as Wuyan for drinking parties and grand banquets.

translations.idiomatic: Bitter cold and pouring rain left the soldiers freezing and starving.

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu said: 'The generals are joining forces to attack Qin, yet we linger here indefinitely without moving forward.'

translations.idiomatic: Now famine grips the land and people starve. Soldiers eat only taro and beans with no grain in sight. Yet he carouses with wine and grand feasts, refusing to cross the river to forage from Zhao, or join forces with Zhao to attack Qin. Instead he says 'we'll exploit their exhaustion.'

translations.idiomatic: If Zhao falls and Qin grows even stronger, what exhaustion will there be to exploit!

translations.idiomatic: Moreover, our army has just suffered defeat. The king cannot rest easy. He has committed the entire nation to your command. The survival of the state hangs on this single decision.

context.previous: 趙舉而秦彊，何敝之承！

translations.idiomatic: Now he shows no concern for the soldiers while pursuing his personal interests. Such a man is no true servant of the realm.'

translations.literal: At this time, all the generals were terrified and submissive, none dared to branch out or dispute.
translations.idiomatic: At this moment, all the generals were cowed into submission. None dared to raise objections or go against him.

context.previous: 項羽晨朝上將軍宋義，即其帳中斬宋義頭，出令軍中曰：「宋義與齊謀反楚，楚王陰令羽誅之。」
context.next: 皆曰：「首立楚者，將軍家也。

translations.chinese: 皆曰：「首立楚者，將軍家也。
translations.literal: All said: 'The first to establish Chu was the general's family.
translations.idiomatic: They all declared: 'Your family was the first to restore the Chu royal line.'

context.previous: 當是時，諸將皆慴服，莫敢枝梧。
context.next: 今將軍誅亂。」

translations.chinese: 今將軍誅亂。」
translations.literal: Now the general has executed the rebel.'
translations.idiomatic: Now you, General, have put down the traitor.'

context.previous: 皆曰：「首立楚者，將軍家也。
context.next: 乃相與共立羽為假上將軍。

translations.chinese: 乃相與共立羽為假上將軍。
translations.literal: They then together established Yu as Acting Supreme General.
translations.idiomatic: They then jointly appointed Xiang Yu as Acting Supreme Commander.

context.previous: 今將軍誅亂。」
context.next: 使人追宋義子，及之齊，殺之。

translations.chinese: 使人追宋義子，及之齊，殺之。
translations.literal: He sent people to pursue Song Yi's son, caught up with him in Qi, and killed him.
translations.idiomatic: He dispatched men to pursue Song Yi's son. They caught up with him in Qi and executed him.

context.previous: 乃相與共立羽為假上將軍。
context.next: 使桓楚報命於懷王。

translations.chinese: 使桓楚報命於懷王。
translations.literal: He sent Huan Chu to report the command to King Huai.
translations.idiomatic: He dispatched Huan Chu to report the developments to King Huai.

context.previous: 使人追宋義子，及之齊，殺之。
context.next: 懷王因使項羽為上將軍，當陽君、蒲將軍皆屬項羽。

translations.chinese: 懷王因使項羽為上將軍，當陽君、蒲將軍皆屬項羽。
translations.literal: King Huai therefore made Xiang Yu Supreme General, and Lord Dangyang and General Pu were both subordinate to Xiang Yu.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai therefore appointed Xiang Yu as Supreme Commander, with Lord Dangyang and General Pu both serving under his command.

context.previous: 使桓楚報命於懷王。

translations.chinese: 項羽已殺卿子冠軍，威震楚國，名聞諸侯。
translations.literal: Xiang Yu had already killed Lord Champion, his might shook Chu kingdom, his name was heard among the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu had executed Lord Champion. His might shook the entire Chu realm, and his reputation spread among all the feudal lords.

context.next: 乃遣當陽君、蒲將軍將卒二萬渡河，救鉅鹿。

translations.chinese: 乃遣當陽君、蒲將軍將卒二萬渡河，救鉅鹿。
translations.literal: He then sent Lord Dangyang and General Pu to lead twenty thousand troops to cross the river and rescue Julu.
translations.idiomatic: He then dispatched Lord Dangyang and General Pu with twenty thousand soldiers to cross the Yellow River and relieve Julu.

context.previous: 項羽已殺卿子冠軍，威震楚國，名聞諸侯。
context.next: 戰少利，陳餘復請兵。

translations.chinese: 戰少利，陳餘復請兵。
translations.literal: The battle gained little advantage, Chen Yu again requested troops.
translations.idiomatic: The fighting yielded scant success, so Chen Yu requested reinforcements once more.

context.previous: 乃遣當陽君、蒲將軍將卒二萬渡河，救鉅鹿。
context.next: 項羽乃悉引兵渡河，皆沈船，破釜甑，燒廬舍，持三日糧，以示士卒必死，無一還心。

translations.chinese: 項羽乃悉引兵渡河，皆沈船，破釜甑，燒廬舍，持三日糧，以示士卒必死，無一還心。
translations.literal: Xiang Yu then led all his troops to cross the river, they all sank the boats, smashed the cauldrons and kettles, burned the huts, carrying only three days of rations, to show the soldiers they must die, with not one thought of returning.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu then led his entire army across the river. They sank all the boats, smashed the cooking pots, burned the camp shelters, and carried only three days' rations. This demonstrated to the soldiers that they must fight to the death with no possibility of retreat.

context.previous: 戰少利，陳餘復請兵。
context.next: 於是至則圍王離，與秦軍遇，九戰，絕其甬道，大破之，殺蘇角，虜王離。

translations.chinese: 於是至則圍王離，與秦軍遇，九戰，絕其甬道，大破之，殺蘇角，虜王離。
translations.literal: Thereupon upon arriving they surrounded Wang Li, encountered the Qin army, fought nine battles, cut off their covered walkway, greatly defeated them, killed Su Jiao, and captured Wang Li.
translations.idiomatic: Upon arrival, they surrounded Wang Li. They clashed with the Qin forces in nine battles, severed their supply line, decisively defeated them, killed Su Jiao, and took Wang Li prisoner.

context.previous: 項羽乃悉引兵渡河，皆沈船，破釜甑，燒廬舍，持三日糧，以示士卒必死，無一還心。
context.next: 涉閒不降楚，自燒殺。

translations.chinese: 涉閒不降楚，自燒殺。
translations.literal: She Jian did not surrender to Chu, set fire to himself and died.
translations.idiomatic: She Jian refused to surrender to Chu and perished in self-immolation.

context.previous: 於是至則圍王離，與秦軍遇，九戰，絕其甬道，大破之，殺蘇角，虜王離。
context.next: 當是時，楚兵冠諸侯。

translations.chinese: 當是時，楚兵冠諸侯。
translations.literal: At this time, Chu troops were the best among the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: At this juncture, the Chu army was preeminent among all the feudal lords.

context.previous: 涉閒不降楚，自燒殺。
context.next: 諸侯軍救鉅鹿下者十餘壁，莫敢縱兵。

translations.chinese: 諸侯軍救鉅鹿下者十餘壁，莫敢縱兵。
translations.literal: The feudal lords' armies that came to rescue Julu camped below it with more than ten fortifications, none dared to unleash their troops.
translations.idiomatic: The armies of the various feudal lords that came to relieve Julu established more than ten fortified camps below the city, but none dared to engage their troops.

context.previous: 當是時，楚兵冠諸侯。
context.next: 及楚擊秦，諸將皆從壁上觀。

translations.chinese: 及楚擊秦，諸將皆從壁上觀。
translations.literal: When Chu attacked Qin, all the generals watched from their fortifications.
translations.idiomatic: When Chu attacked Qin, all the other generals merely watched from atop their defensive walls.

context.previous: 諸侯軍救鉅鹿下者十餘壁，莫敢縱兵。
context.next: 楚戰士無不一以當十，楚兵呼聲動天，諸侯軍無不人人惴恐。

translations.chinese: 楚戰士無不一以當十，楚兵呼聲動天，諸侯軍無不人人惴恐。
translations.literal: Chu warriors without exception each matched ten, Chu troops' battle cries shook heaven, the feudal lords' armies without exception each man was terrified.
translations.idiomatic: Every Chu warrior fought like ten men. Their battle cries shook the heavens. Every soldier in the other lords' armies trembled with fear.

context.previous: 及楚擊秦，諸將皆從壁上觀。
context.next: 於是已破秦軍，項羽召見諸侯將，入轅門，無不膝行而前，莫敢仰視。

translations.chinese: 於是已破秦軍，項羽召見諸侯將，入轅門，無不膝行而前，莫敢仰視。
translations.literal: Thereupon having defeated the Qin army, Xiang Yu summoned the feudal lords' generals to an audience, they entered the camp gate, without exception crawled forward on their knees, none dared to look up.
translations.idiomatic: Having defeated the Qin army, Xiang Yu summoned the generals of the various lords for an audience. As they entered the camp gate, every one of them crawled forward on their knees, none daring to look up.

context.previous: 楚戰士無不一以當十，楚兵呼聲動天，諸侯軍無不人人惴恐。
context.next: 項羽由是始為諸侯上將軍，諸侯皆屬焉。

translations.chinese: 項羽由是始為諸侯上將軍，諸侯皆屬焉。
translations.literal: Xiang Yu from this became the Supreme General of the feudal lords, all the feudal lords were subordinate to him.
translations.idiomatic: From this point on, Xiang Yu became the Supreme Commander of all the feudal lords, and they all acknowledged his authority.

context.previous: 於是已破秦軍，項羽召見諸侯將，入轅門，無不膝行而前，莫敢仰視。

translations.chinese: 章邯軍棘原，項羽軍漳南，相持未戰。
translations.literal: Zhang Han's army camped at Ji Yuan, Xiang Yu's army at Zhang south, they faced each other but had not yet fought.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Han's forces were encamped at Jiyuan, Xiang Yu's at the south bank of the Zhang River. They confronted each other but had not yet engaged in battle.

context.next: 秦軍數卻，二世使人讓章邯。

translations.chinese: 秦軍數卻，二世使人讓章邯。
translations.literal: The Qin army repeatedly retreated, the Second Emperor sent people to rebuke Zhang Han.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin army suffered repeated setbacks. The Second Emperor sent envoys to reprimand Zhang Han.

context.previous: 章邯軍棘原，項羽軍漳南，相持未戰。
context.next: 章邯恐，使長史欣請事。

translations.chinese: 章邯恐，使長史欣請事。
translations.literal: Zhang Han was afraid, sent his chief clerk Xin to request surrender terms.
translations.idiomatic: Terrified, Zhang Han sent his chief clerk Sima Xin to negotiate surrender terms.

context.previous: 秦軍數卻，二世使人讓章邯。
context.next: 至咸陽，留司馬門三日，趙高不見，有不信之心。

translations.chinese: 至咸陽，留司馬門三日，趙高不見，有不信之心。
translations.literal: They arrived at Xianyang, waited at the Sima Gate for three days, Zhao Gao did not see them, had distrustful thoughts.
translations.idiomatic: They reached Xianyang and waited at the Sima Gate for three days. Zhao Gao refused to meet them, harboring suspicions.

context.previous: 章邯恐，使長史欣請事。
context.next: 長史欣恐，還走其軍，不敢出故道，趙高果使人追之，不及。

translations.chinese: 長史欣恐，還走其軍，不敢出故道，趙高果使人追之，不及。
translations.literal: Chief clerk Xin was afraid, returned and fled to his army, dared not take the old road, Zhao Gao indeed sent people to pursue him, but did not catch up.
translations.idiomatic: Terrified, Chief Clerk Xin fled back to his army, not daring to take the usual route. Zhao Gao indeed sent pursuers, but they failed to catch him.

context.previous: 至咸陽，留司馬門三日，趙高不見，有不信之心。
context.next: 欣至軍，報曰：「趙高用事於中，下無可為者。

translations.chinese: 欣至軍，報曰：「趙高用事於中，下無可為者。
translations.literal: Xin reached the army, reported saying: 'Zhao Gao holds power in the court, below there is nothing that can be done.
translations.idiomatic: Xin reached the army and reported: 'Zhao Gao controls the court from within. There's nothing we can accomplish down here.'

context.previous: 長史欣恐，還走其軍，不敢出故道，趙高果使人追之，不及。
context.next: 今戰能勝，高必疾妒吾功；

translations.chinese: 今戰能勝，高必疾妒吾功；
translations.literal: Now if we fight and can win, Gao will certainly be jealous of our achievements;
translations.idiomatic: If we fight and win now, Zhao Gao will surely envy our success.

context.previous: 欣至軍，報曰：「趙高用事於中，下無可為者。
context.next: 戰不能勝，不免於死。

translations.chinese: 戰不能勝，不免於死。
translations.literal: If we fight and cannot win, we cannot avoid death.
translations.idiomatic: If we fight and lose, death is inevitable.

context.previous: 今戰能勝，高必疾妒吾功；
context.next: 願將軍孰計之。」

translations.chinese: 願將軍孰計之。」
translations.literal: I wish the general to carefully consider this.'
translations.idiomatic: I urge you, General, to ponder this carefully.'

context.previous: 戰不能勝，不免於死。
context.next: 陳餘亦遺章邯書曰：「白起為秦將，南征鄢郢，北阬馬服，攻城略地，不可勝計，而竟賜死。

translations.chinese: 陳餘亦遺章邯書曰：「白起為秦將，南征鄢郢，北阬馬服，攻城略地，不可勝計，而竟賜死。
translations.literal: Chen Yu also sent Zhang Han a letter saying: 'Bai Qi served as Qin general, campaigned south against Yan and Ying, north buried Ma Fu alive, attacked cities and seized territory beyond counting, yet in the end was granted death.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Yu also sent Zhang Han a letter: 'Bai Qi, as Qin's general, campaigned south against Yan and Ying, north buried Ma Fu alive in a mass grave, conquered cities and seized territories too numerous to count, yet was ultimately executed.'

context.previous: 願將軍孰計之。」
context.next: 蒙恬為秦將，北逐戎人，開榆中地數千里，竟斬陽周。

translations.chinese: 蒙恬為秦將，北逐戎人，開榆中地數千里，竟斬陽周。
translations.literal: Meng Tian served as Qin general, drove the Rong people north, opened up several thousand li of Yuzhong territory, yet in the end was executed at Yangzhou.
translations.idiomatic: Meng Tian, as Qin's general, drove the Rong nomads northward, opened up thousands of li of territory in the Yuzhong region, yet was ultimately executed at Yangzhou.

context.previous: 陳餘亦遺章邯書曰：「白起為秦將，南征鄢郢，北阬馬服，攻城略地，不可勝計，而竟賜死。
context.next: 何者？

translations.chinese: 何者？
translations.literal: Why?
translations.idiomatic: Why was that?

context.previous: 蒙恬為秦將，北逐戎人，開榆中地數千里，竟斬陽周。
context.next: 功多，秦不能盡封，因以法誅之。

translations.chinese: 功多，秦不能盡封，因以法誅之。
translations.literal: Their achievements were great, Qin could not fully reward them, so executed them according to law.
translations.idiomatic: Their merits were too great. Qin could not adequately reward them all, so they were executed on legal pretexts.

context.previous: 何者？
context.next: 今將軍為秦將三歲矣，所亡失以十萬數，而諸侯并起滋益多。

translations.chinese: 今將軍為秦將三歲矣，所亡失以十萬數，而諸侯并起滋益多。
translations.literal: Now the general has served as Qin general for three years, the losses he has suffered number in the hundreds of thousands, yet the feudal lords have arisen and grown increasingly numerous.
translations.idiomatic: You have served as Qin's general for three years now. Your casualties number in the hundreds of thousands, yet the feudal lords have risen up and multiplied.

context.previous: 功多，秦不能盡封，因以法誅之。
context.next: 彼趙高素諛日久，今事急，亦恐二世誅之，故欲以法誅將軍以塞責，使人更代將軍以脫其禍。

translations.chinese: 彼趙高素諛日久，今事急，亦恐二世誅之，故欲以法誅將軍以塞責，使人更代將軍以脫其禍。
translations.literal: That Zhao Gao has long been flattering daily, now the situation is urgent, he also fears the Second Emperor will execute him, so he wants to execute the general according to law to fulfill his duty, and send someone to replace the general to escape his own calamity.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Gao has been flattering the emperor for years. Now that the situation is critical, he fears the Second Emperor will execute him. So he wants to execute you, General, under legal pretexts to cover his own responsibility, and send a replacement to escape his own doom.

context.previous: 今將軍為秦將三歲矣，所亡失以十萬數，而諸侯并起滋益多。
context.next: 夫將軍居外久，多內卻，有功亦誅，無功亦誅。

translations.chinese: 夫將軍居外久，多內卻，有功亦誅，無功亦誅。
translations.literal: As for the general staying outside for a long time, many internal retreats, with achievement also executed, without achievement also executed.
translations.idiomatic: You, General, have been campaigning abroad for so long. With so many internal setbacks, you'll be executed whether you succeed or fail.

context.previous: 彼趙高素諛日久，今事急，亦恐二世誅之，故欲以法誅將軍以塞責，使人更代將軍以脫其禍。
context.next: 且天之亡秦，無愚智皆知之。

translations.chinese: 且天之亡秦，無愚智皆知之。
translations.literal: Moreover, Heaven's abandonment of Qin, both wise and foolish all know it.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, Heaven has clearly abandoned Qin. Even the foolish know this.

context.previous: 夫將軍居外久，多內卻，有功亦誅，無功亦誅。
context.next: 今將軍內不能直諫，外為亡國將，孤特獨立而欲常存，豈不哀哉！

translations.chinese: 今將軍內不能直諫，外為亡國將，孤特獨立而欲常存，豈不哀哉！
translations.literal: Now the general cannot remonstrate frankly within, outside serves as general of a doomed state, isolated and alone yet wishes to survive forever, is this not lamentable!
translations.idiomatic: You cannot speak frankly at court, and abroad you serve as general of a doomed dynasty. Standing isolated and alone, you hope to survive forever. How lamentable!

context.previous: 且天之亡秦，無愚智皆知之。
context.next: 將軍何不還兵與諸侯為從，約共攻秦，分王其地，南面稱孤；

translations.chinese: 將軍何不還兵與諸侯為從，約共攻秦，分王其地，南面稱孤；
translations.literal: Why does the general not turn his troops back and join with the feudal lords, agree to attack Qin together, divide and rule its territory, face south and style himself king;
translations.idiomatic: Why not turn your troops back and ally with the feudal lords? Agree to attack Qin together, divide its territory among you as kings, and rule facing south as sovereigns.

context.previous: 今將軍內不能直諫，外為亡國將，孤特獨立而欲常存，豈不哀哉！
context.next: 此孰與身伏鈇質，妻子為僇乎？」

translations.chinese: 此孰與身伏鈇質，妻子為僇乎？」
translations.literal: How does this compare with one's body submitting to the axe and block, wife and children becoming prisoners?'
translations.idiomatic: How much better than submitting to the executioner's axe yourself, with your wife and children becoming captives?'

context.previous: 將軍何不還兵與諸侯為從，約共攻秦，分王其地，南面稱孤；
context.next: 章邯狐疑，陰使候始成使項羽，欲約。

translations.chinese: 章邯狐疑，陰使候始成使項羽，欲約。
translations.literal: Zhang Han was doubtful and suspicious, secretly sent the scout Shi Cheng to go to Xiang Yu, wishing to make an agreement.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Han hesitated with suspicion. He secretly sent the scout Shi Cheng to Xiang Yu, hoping to reach an agreement.

context.previous: 此孰與身伏鈇質，妻子為僇乎？」
context.next: 約未成，項羽使蒲將軍日夜引兵度三戶，軍漳南，與秦戰，再破之。

translations.chinese: 約未成，項羽使蒲將軍日夜引兵度三戶，軍漳南，與秦戰，再破之。
translations.literal: The agreement not yet concluded, Xiang Yu sent General Pu to lead troops day and night to cross at Sanhu, camp south of the Zhang, fight with Qin, and defeat them again.
translations.idiomatic: Before the agreement was finalized, Xiang Yu sent General Pu to lead troops across the Sanhu ford day and night. They encamped south of the Zhang River, engaged the Qin forces, and defeated them once more.

context.previous: 章邯狐疑，陰使候始成使項羽，欲約。
context.next: 項羽悉引兵擊秦軍汙水上，大破之。

translations.chinese: 項羽悉引兵擊秦軍汙水上，大破之。
translations.literal: Xiang Yu led all his troops to attack the Qin army on the Wushui, greatly defeating them.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu led his entire army to attack the Qin forces along the Wushui River and decisively defeated them.

context.previous: 約未成，項羽使蒲將軍日夜引兵度三戶，軍漳南，與秦戰，再破之。

translations.chinese: 章邯使人見項羽，欲約。
translations.literal: Zhang Han sent people to see Xiang Yu, wishing to make an agreement.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Han sent envoys to meet with Xiang Yu, hoping to reach an agreement.

context.next: 項羽召軍吏謀曰：「糧少，欲聽其約。」

translations.chinese: 項羽召軍吏謀曰：「糧少，欲聽其約。」
translations.literal: Xiang Yu summoned the army officers to consult, saying: 'Provisions are few, I wish to accept their agreement.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu summoned his officers for a conference: 'Our supplies are running low. I want to accept their proposal.'

context.previous: 章邯使人見項羽，欲約。
context.next: 軍吏皆曰：「善。」

translations.chinese: 軍吏皆曰：「善。」
translations.literal: The army officers all said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: All the officers replied: 'Excellent.'

context.previous: 項羽召軍吏謀曰：「糧少，欲聽其約。」
context.next: 項羽乃與期洹水南殷虛上。

translations.chinese: 項羽乃與期洹水南殷虛上。
translations.literal: Xiang Yu then made an appointment with them south of the Huan River at Yin Xu.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu then arranged to meet them south of the Huan River at the ruins of Yin.

context.previous: 軍吏皆曰：「善。」
context.next: 已盟，章邯見項羽而流涕，為言趙高。

translations.chinese: 已盟，章邯見項羽而流涕，為言趙高。
translations.literal: The covenant already concluded, Zhang Han saw Xiang Yu and shed tears, spoke for Zhao Gao.
translations.idiomatic: Once the covenant was sealed, Zhang Han met Xiang Yu and wept, speaking on Zhao Gao's behalf.

context.previous: 項羽乃與期洹水南殷虛上。
context.next: 項羽乃立章邯為雍王，置楚軍中。

translations.chinese: 項羽乃立章邯為雍王，置楚軍中。
translations.literal: Xiang Yu then established Zhang Han as King of Yong, placed him in the Chu army.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu then installed Zhang Han as King of Yong and kept him within the Chu encampment.

context.previous: 已盟，章邯見項羽而流涕，為言趙高。

translations.idiomatic: And a pair of jade goblets, bowing twice to present them at the Supreme General's feet.'

translations.idiomatic: A few days later, Xiang Yu led his army west and massacred the population of Xianyang. He executed the surrendered Qin prince Zi Ying and set fire to the Qin palaces. The flames burned for three months without going out.

translations.idiomatic: Someone advised King Xiang: 'Guanzhong is protected on four sides by mountains and rivers. The land is fertile and rich. It would make an excellent capital from which to rule.'

translations.chinese: 項王見秦宮皆以燒殘破，又心懷思欲東歸，曰：「富貴不歸故鄉，如衣繡夜行，誰知之者！」
translations.literal: King Xiang saw that the Qin palaces were all burned and ruined, moreover his heart longed for home and wished to return east, said: 'To be wealthy and noble but not return to one's hometown is like wearing embroidered clothes at night—who would know!'
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang saw that the Qin palaces were all burned and in ruins. He longed for home and wished to return east, saying: 'To achieve wealth and nobility but not return to your hometown is like wearing fine embroidered clothes in the dark—who would know!'

translations.idiomatic: Yet those who personally donned armor and wielded weapons to lead the charge, exposed to the elements in the wilderness for three years, who destroyed Qin and brought peace to the world—all this was due to the efforts of you generals, chancellors, and myself.

translations.literal: King Xiang and Fan Zeng suspected that the Duke of Pei would possess the world, the matter was already settled, moreover they disliked breaking agreements, feared the feudal lords would rebel against them, so secretly plotted saying: 'The roads to Ba and Shu are dangerous, Qin's banished people all live in Shu.'
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang and Fan Zeng suspected that the Duke of Pei would eventually rule the world. The matter was already settled, and they disliked breaking agreements for fear the feudal lords would rebel. So they secretly plotted: 'The roads to Ba and Shu are treacherous, and all of Qin's banished criminals live in Shu.'

translations.literal: They then said: 'Ba and Shu are also Guanzhong territory.'
translations.idiomatic: They reasoned: 'Ba and Shu are also part of Guanzhong.'

translations.idiomatic: They divided Guanzhong into three parts and installed the surrendered Qin generals as kings to block and contain the King of Han.

translations.idiomatic: King Xiang then installed Zhang Han as King of Yong, giving him control west of Xianyang, with his capital at Feiqiu.

translations.idiomatic: Commandant Dong Yi had originally been the one who persuaded Zhang Han to surrender to Chu.

context.previous: 徙魏王豹為西魏王，王河東，都平陽。
context.next: 韓王成因故都，都陽翟。

translations.chinese: 韓王成因故都，都陽翟。
translations.literal: King Cheng of Han remained at his original capital, capital Yangdi.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng of Han kept his original capital at Yangdi.

context.previous: 瑕丘申陽者，張耳嬖臣也，先下河南（郡），迎楚河上，故立申陽為河南王，都雒陽。
context.next: 趙將司馬卬定河內，數有功，故立卬為殷王，王河內，都朝歌。

translations.chinese: 趙將司馬卬定河內，數有功，故立卬為殷王，王河內，都朝歌。
translations.literal: Zhao general Sima Ang pacified Henan, repeatedly achieved merit, therefore established Ang as King of Yin, ruling Henan, with capital at Zhaoge.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao general Sima Ang pacified Henan and achieved repeated successes. Therefore they installed him as King of Yin, giving him control of Henan, with his capital at Zhaoge.

context.previous: 韓王成因故都，都陽翟。
context.next: 徙趙王歇為代王。

translations.chinese: 徙趙王歇為代王。
translations.literal: Moved King Xie of Zhao to become King of Dai.
translations.idiomatic: They relocated King Xie of Zhao to become King of Dai.

context.previous: 趙將司馬卬定河內，數有功，故立卬為殷王，王河內，都朝歌。
context.next: 趙相張耳素賢，又從入關，故立耳為常山王，王趙地，都襄國。

translations.chinese: 趙相張耳素賢，又從入關，故立耳為常山王，王趙地，都襄國。
translations.literal: Zhao chancellor Zhang Er was long known for his worthiness, moreover followed into the passes, therefore established Er as King of Changshan, ruling Zhao territory, with capital at Xiangguo.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao chancellor Zhang Er had long been recognized for his worthiness and had followed them into the passes. Therefore they installed him as King of Changshan, giving him control of Zhao territory, with his capital at Xiangguo.

context.previous: 徙趙王歇為代王。
context.next: 當陽君黥布為楚將，常冠軍，故立布為九江王，都六。

translations.chinese: 當陽君黥布為楚將，常冠軍，故立布為九江王，都六。
translations.literal: Lord Dangyang Ying Bu served as Chu general, constantly led the vanguard, therefore established Bu as King of Jiujiang, with capital at Liu.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Dangyang Ying Bu had served as a Chu general and constantly led the vanguard. Therefore they installed him as King of Jiujiang, with his capital at Liu.

context.previous: 趙相張耳素賢，又從入關，故立耳為常山王，王趙地，都襄國。
context.next: 鄱君吳芮率百越佐諸侯，又從入關，故立芮為衡山王，都邾。

translations.chinese: 鄱君吳芮率百越佐諸侯，又從入關，故立芮為衡山王，都邾。
translations.literal: Lord of Po Wu Rui led the hundred Yue to assist the feudal lords, moreover followed into the passes, therefore established Rui as King of Hengshan, with capital at Zhu.
translations.idiomatic: Lord of Po Wu Rui had led the hundred Yue tribes to assist the feudal lords and had followed them into the passes. Therefore they installed him as King of Hengshan, with his capital at Zhu.

context.previous: 當陽君黥布為楚將，常冠軍，故立布為九江王，都六。
context.next: 義帝柱國共敖將兵擊南郡，功多，因立敖為臨江王，都江陵。

translations.chinese: 義帝柱國共敖將兵擊南郡，功多，因立敖為臨江王，都江陵。
translations.literal: The Righteous Emperor's Pillar of State Gong Ao led troops to attack Nanguo, achieved much merit, therefore established Ao as King of Linjiang, with capital at Jiangling.
translations.idiomatic: The Righteous Emperor's Pillar of State Gong Ao led troops to attack Nanguo and achieved great success. Therefore they installed him as King of Linjiang, with his capital at Jiangling.

context.previous: 鄱君吳芮率百越佐諸侯，又從入關，故立芮為衡山王，都邾。
context.next: 徙燕王韓廣為遼東王。

translations.chinese: 徙燕王韓廣為遼東王。
translations.literal: Moved King Guang of Yan to become King of Liaodong.
translations.idiomatic: They relocated King Guang of Yan to become King of Liaodong.

context.previous: 義帝柱國共敖將兵擊南郡，功多，因立敖為臨江王，都江陵。
context.next: 燕將臧荼從楚救趙，因從入關，故立荼為燕王，都薊。

translations.chinese: 燕將臧荼從楚救趙，因從入關，故立荼為燕王，都薊。
translations.literal: Yan general Zang Chu followed Chu to rescue Zhao, moreover followed into the passes, therefore established Chu as King of Yan, with capital at Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Yan general Zang Chu had followed Chu to rescue Zhao and had accompanied them into the passes. Therefore they installed him as King of Yan, with his capital at Ji.

context.previous: 徙燕王韓廣為遼東王。
context.next: 徙齊王田市為膠東王。

translations.chinese: 徙齊王田市為膠東王。
translations.literal: Moved King Shi of Qi to become King of Jiaodong.
translations.idiomatic: They relocated King Shi of Qi to become King of Jiaodong.

context.previous: 燕將臧荼從楚救趙，因從入關，故立荼為燕王，都薊。
context.next: 齊將田都從共救趙，因從入關，故立都為齊王，都臨菑。

translations.chinese: 齊將田都從共救趙，因從入關，故立都為齊王，都臨菑。
translations.literal: Qi general Tian Du followed together to rescue Zhao, moreover followed into the passes, therefore established Du as King of Qi, with capital at Linzi.
translations.idiomatic: Qi general Tian Du had joined the rescue of Zhao and accompanied them into the passes. Therefore they installed him as King of Qi, with his capital at Linzi.

context.previous: 徙齊王田市為膠東王。
context.next: 故秦所滅齊王建孫田安，項羽方渡河救趙，田安下濟北數城，引其兵降項羽，故立安為濟北王，都博陽。

translations.chinese: 故秦所滅齊王建孫田安，項羽方渡河救趙，田安下濟北數城，引其兵降項羽，故立安為濟北王，都博陽。
translations.literal: Formerly Qin destroyed Qi King Jian's grandson Tian An, Xiang Yu was just crossing the river to rescue Zhao, Tian An conquered several cities north of the Ji River, led his troops to surrender to Xiang Yu, therefore established An as King of Jibei, with capital at Boyang.
translations.idiomatic: Tian An, grandson of the Qi King Jian whom Qin had destroyed, conquered several cities north of the Ji River while Xiang Yu was crossing to rescue Zhao. He led his troops to surrender to Xiang Yu. Therefore they installed him as King of Jibei, with his capital at Boyang.

context.previous: 齊將田都從共救趙，因從入關，故立都為齊王，都臨菑。
context.next: 田榮者，數負項梁，又不肯將兵從楚擊秦，以故不封。

translations.chinese: 田榮者，數負項梁，又不肯將兵從楚擊秦，以故不封。
translations.literal: Tian Rong, repeatedly betrayed Xiang Liang, moreover refused to lead troops following Chu to attack Qin, for this reason was not enfeoffed.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong had repeatedly betrayed Xiang Liang and refused to lead troops to follow Chu in attacking Qin. For this reason, he was not enfeoffed.

context.previous: 故秦所滅齊王建孫田安，項羽方渡河救趙，田安下濟北數城，引其兵降項羽，故立安為濟北王，都博陽。
context.next: 成安君陳餘棄將印去，不從入關，然素聞其賢，有功於趙，聞其在南皮，故因環封三縣。

translations.chinese: 成安君陳餘棄將印去，不從入關，然素聞其賢，有功於趙，聞其在南皮，故因環封三縣。
translations.literal: Lord Cheng'an Chen Yu abandoned his general's seal and departed, did not follow into the passes, yet long known for his worthiness, had merit in Zhao, heard he was in Nanpi, therefore provisionally enfeoffed three counties around it.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Cheng'an Chen Yu had abandoned his general's seal and left, refusing to follow into the passes. Yet he was long known for his worthiness and had merit in Zhao. Hearing he was in Nanpi, they provisionally enfeoffed him with three surrounding counties.

context.previous: 田榮者，數負項梁，又不肯將兵從楚擊秦，以故不封。
context.next: 番君將梅鋗功多，故封十萬戶侯。

translations.chinese: 番君將梅鋗功多，故封十萬戶侯。
translations.literal: Lord of Fan's general Mei Dun achieved much merit, therefore enfeoffed as marquis of one hundred thousand households.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Fan's general Mei Dun had achieved great merit. Therefore he was enfeoffed as a marquis with one hundred thousand households.

context.previous: 成安君陳餘棄將印去，不從入關，然素聞其賢，有功於趙，聞其在南皮，故因環封三縣。
context.next: 項王自立為西楚霸王，王九郡，都彭城。

translations.chinese: 項王自立為西楚霸王，王九郡，都彭城。
translations.literal: King Xiang self-established as Hegemon King of Western Chu, ruling nine commanderies, with capital at Pengcheng.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang established himself as Hegemon King of Western Chu, ruling nine commanderies, with his capital at Pengcheng.

context.previous: 番君將梅鋗功多，故封十萬戶侯。

translations.chinese: 漢之元年四月，諸侯罷戲下，各就國。
translations.literal: In the fourth month of the first year of Han, the feudal lords departed from below Xi, each going to their kingdoms.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of the first year of Han, the feudal lords left the area below Xi and each returned to their kingdoms.

context.next: 項王出之國，使人徙義帝，曰：「古之帝者地方千里，必居上游。」

translations.chinese: 項王出之國，使人徙義帝，曰：「古之帝者地方千里，必居上游。」
translations.literal: King Xiang sent out from his kingdom, sent people to move the Righteous Emperor, saying: 'Ancient emperors had territories of a thousand li, must reside upstream.'
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang sent orders from his kingdom to relocate the Righteous Emperor, saying: 'Ancient emperors ruled territories of a thousand li and always resided upstream.'

context.previous: 漢之元年四月，諸侯罷戲下，各就國。
context.next: 乃使使徙義帝長沙郴縣。

translations.chinese: 乃使使徙義帝長沙郴縣。
translations.literal: Then sent envoys to move the Righteous Emperor to Chen county in Changsha.
translations.idiomatic: He then sent envoys to relocate the Righteous Emperor to Chen county in Changsha.

context.previous: 項王出之國，使人徙義帝，曰：「古之帝者地方千里，必居上游。」
context.next: 趣義帝行，其群臣稍稍背叛之，乃陰令衡山、臨江王擊殺之江中。

translations.chinese: 趣義帝行，其群臣稍稍背叛之，乃陰令衡山、臨江王擊殺之江中。
translations.literal: Urged the Righteous Emperor to travel, his ministers gradually deserted him, then secretly ordered the Kings of Hengshan and Linjiang to attack and kill him in the river.
translations.idiomatic: He urged the Righteous Emperor to proceed on his journey. His ministers gradually deserted him. Xiang Yu then secretly ordered the Kings of Hengshan and Linjiang to attack and kill him in the river.

context.previous: 乃使使徙義帝長沙郴縣。
context.next: 韓王成無軍功，項王不使之國，與俱至彭城，廢以為侯，已又殺之。

translations.chinese: 韓王成無軍功，項王不使之國，與俱至彭城，廢以為侯，已又殺之。
translations.literal: King Cheng of Han had no military merit, King Xiang did not send him to his kingdom, brought him together to Pengcheng, demoted him to marquis, then again killed him.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng of Han had no military merit. King Xiang did not allow him to go to his kingdom but brought him to Pengcheng, demoted him to marquis, and then killed him.

context.previous: 趣義帝行，其群臣稍稍背叛之，乃陰令衡山、臨江王擊殺之江中。
context.next: 臧荼之國，因逐韓廣之遼東，廣弗聽，荼擊殺廣無終，

translations.chinese: 臧荼之國，因逐韓廣之遼東，廣弗聽，荼擊殺廣無終，
translations.literal: Zang Chu went to his kingdom, then pursued Han Guang to Liaodong, Guang did not listen, Chu attacked and killed Guang at Wuzhong,
translations.idiomatic: Zang Chu went to his kingdom and then pursued Han Guang to Liaodong. Han Guang refused to comply, so Zang Chu attacked and killed him at Wuzhong.

context.previous: 韓王成無軍功，項王不使之國，與俱至彭城，廢以為侯，已又殺之。

translations.chinese: 田榮聞項羽徙齊王市膠東，而立齊將田都為齊王，乃大怒，不肯遣齊王之膠東，因以齊反，迎擊田都。
translations.literal: Tian Rong heard Xiang Yu moved Qi King Shi to Jiaodong, and established Qi general Tian Du as King of Qi, then greatly angered, refused to send the Qi king to Jiaodong, therefore with Qi rebelled, met and attacked Tian Du.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong learned that Xiang Yu had moved Qi King Shi to Jiaodong and installed Qi general Tian Du as King of Qi. He flew into a rage, refused to send the Qi king to Jiaodong, and led Qi in rebellion, attacking Tian Du.

context.next: 田都走楚。

translations.chinese: 田都走楚。
translations.literal: Tian Du fled to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Du escaped to Chu.

context.previous: 田榮聞項羽徙齊王市膠東，而立齊將田都為齊王，乃大怒，不肯遣齊王之膠東，因以齊反，迎擊田都。
context.next: 齊王市畏項王，乃亡之膠東就國。

translations.chinese: 齊王市畏項王，乃亡之膠東就國。
translations.literal: Qi King Shi feared King Xiang, then fled to Jiaodong to take up his kingdom.
translations.idiomatic: Qi King Shi feared King Xiang and fled to Jiaodong to assume his kingship.

context.previous: 田都走楚。
context.next: 田榮怒，追擊殺之即墨。

translations.chinese: 田榮怒，追擊殺之即墨。
translations.literal: Tian Rong angered, pursued and attacked, killed him at Jimo.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong, enraged, pursued and attacked him, killing Qi King Shi at Jimo.

context.previous: 齊王市畏項王，乃亡之膠東就國。
context.next: 榮因自立為齊王，而西殺擊濟北王田安，并王三齊。

translations.chinese: 榮因自立為齊王，而西殺擊濟北王田安，并王三齊。
translations.literal: Rong therefore self-established as King of Qi, and westward attacked and killed Jibei King Tian An, united and ruled the three Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong therefore proclaimed himself King of Qi. He attacked westward and killed Jibei King Tian An, uniting all three Qi regions under his rule.

context.previous: 田榮怒，追擊殺之即墨。
context.next: 榮與彭越將軍印，令反梁地。

translations.chinese: 榮與彭越將軍印，令反梁地。
translations.literal: Rong gave Peng Yue the general's seal, ordered him to rebel in Liang territory.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong gave Peng Yue a general's seal and ordered him to rebel in Liang territory.

context.previous: 榮因自立為齊王，而西殺擊濟北王田安，并王三齊。
context.next: 陳餘陰使張同、夏說說齊王田榮曰：「項羽為天下宰，不平。

translations.chinese: 陳餘陰使張同、夏說說齊王田榮曰：「項羽為天下宰，不平。
translations.literal: Chen Yu secretly sent Zhang Tong and Xia Yue to persuade Qi King Tian Rong saying: 'Xiang Yu acts as butcher of the world, not fair.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Yu secretly sent Zhang Tong and Xia Yue to persuade Qi King Tian Rong: 'Xiang Yu acts as the world's butcher. His actions are unfair.'

context.previous: 榮與彭越將軍印，令反梁地。
context.next: 今盡王故王於醜地，而王其群臣諸將善地，逐其故主趙王，乃北居代，餘以為不可。

translations.chinese: 今盡王故王於醜地，而王其群臣諸將善地，逐其故主趙王，乃北居代，餘以為不可。
translations.literal: Now completely kings the former kings in bad lands, but kings his ministers and generals in good lands, drives out their former lord King of Zhao, makes him reside north in Dai, Yu considers it not right.
translations.idiomatic: Now he installs all the former kings in barren lands but gives his ministers and generals the fertile territories. He drives out their former lord, King of Zhao, and forces him to live in the north in Dai. I consider this unjust.'

context.previous: 陳餘陰使張同、夏說說齊王田榮曰：「項羽為天下宰，不平。
context.next: 聞大王起兵，且不聽不義，願大王資餘兵，請以擊常山，以復趙王，請以國為捍蔽。」

translations.chinese: 聞大王起兵，且不聽不義，願大王資餘兵，請以擊常山，以復趙王，請以國為捍蔽。」
translations.literal: Heard Your Majesty raised troops, moreover does not listen to unrighteous matters, wish Your Majesty provide Yu with troops, request to attack Changshan, to restore the King of Zhao, request to use the kingdom as shield.'
translations.idiomatic: I hear Your Majesty has raised troops and refuses to heed injustice. I wish Your Majesty would provide me with troops to attack Changshan, restore the King of Zhao, and use my kingdom as a protective barrier.'

context.previous: 今盡王故王於醜地，而王其群臣諸將善地，逐其故主趙王，乃北居代，餘以為不可。
context.next: 齊王許之，因遣兵之趙。
